channel.title: Comments on: SQLCop A Tool To Highlight Potential Problems With Your Database
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: James
item.dc:creator: James
item.description:
I'm getting a Run-time error '9' Subscript out of range, error message as soon as I launch the application.
It doesn't even get to the login screen shown.
item.content:encoded:
I’m getting a Run-time error ‘9’ Subscript out of range, error message as soon as I launch the application.

It doesn’t even get to the login screen shown.

item.title: By: JohnM
item.dc:creator: JohnM
item.description: Looks like a nice tool. Too bad it requires a DB connection to run. It would be great if it could run against a sql file.
item.content:encoded: Looks like a nice tool. Too bad it requires a DB connection to run. It would be great if it could run against a sql file.

item.title: By: George Mastros (gmmastros)
item.dc:creator: George Mastros (gmmastros)
item.description: Thanks for bringing this to our attention Paul. We've already been notified of this problem and we are currently working on a solution.
item.content:encoded: Thanks for bringing this to our attention Paul. We’ve already been notified of this problem and we are currently working on a solution.

item.title: By: Paul
item.dc:creator: Paul
item.description: Doesn't seem to work on case sensitive databases. In the column name check for example it looks in Information_Schema.Columns where is should be doing a select from INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS.
item.content:encoded: Doesn’t seem to work on case sensitive databases. In the column name check for example it looks in Information_Schema.Columns where is should be doing a select from INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS.

item.title: By: manjot
item.dc:creator: manjot
item.description: How is this tool different from Microsoft Best practices analyser?
item.content:encoded: How is this tool different from Microsoft Best practices analyser?

item.title: By: oldjeep
item.dc:creator: oldjeep
item.description: Placed a post in the forum - it actually has to do with the application and my AVG firewall
item.content:encoded: Placed a post in the forum – it actually has to do with the application and my AVG firewall

item.title: By: Jon
item.dc:creator: Jon
item.description: Came here to report the same issue as Chuck. Crashes when connecting to SQL 2008.
item.content:encoded: Came here to report the same issue as Chuck. Crashes when connecting to SQL 2008.

item.title: By: Chuck
item.dc:creator: Chuck
item.content:encoded:
Seems to blow up if you are connecting to a SQL2008 R2 server. Subscript out of range
Source SQLCop.frmMain.LoadNotes
Paramteters: Version = SQL2008

Source SQLCop.frmMain.SetVersion
Paramteters: Version = SQL2008

Source SQLCop.frmLogin.btnConnect_Click
Paramteters:

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: Peter, I didn't do any audio on the video since the tool doesn't make any sounds :-) But I get your point, maybe I will do captions next time
item.content:encoded: Peter, I didn’t do any audio on the video since the tool doesn’t make any sounds ðŸ™‚ But I get your point, maybe I will do captions next time
